Class: BasePage

BasePage

new BasePage()

The Base Page Object class

A Base page object class that is extended by all other page objects. Common functions to all pages can be placed here.

Source:
  • pageObjects/_base.page.js, line 5

<static> elementIsOnPage(element) → {boolean}

Determines if an element is on the current page.

Searches the known selectors in the current page object, and queries the DOM for a match. Returns a boolean if the element exists. Does not have to be visible to provide a truthy return.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
element string

the element that you are searching for
Source:
  • pageObjects/_base.page.js, line 130
Returns:

If true, an element matching the (element) parameter is on the current page.

Type
boolean

<static> isOnPage(skipWait) → {boolean}

Waits for a specific element to load to indicate the page has finished loading.

If the skipWait parameter is used, it does not wait for the element to be visible and check for visibility as soon as the DOM has finished loading. This is useful to call after attempting to load a new page, so that the next command does not fire before the second page has had a chance to load all the way.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
skipWait boolean

(optional) - optionally skips the waitForVisible() command.
Source:
  • pageObjects/_base.page.js, line 84
Returns:

If true, the page is assumed to have finished loading.

Type
boolean

<static> validatePageTitle() → {boolean}

Get the current title from Selenium and compare it to the title in the uimap,.

Waits until they both are the same before returning a boolean, otherwise it throws a timeout exception.

Source:
  • pageObjects/_base.page.js, line 180
Throws:

Throws error if page title is not updated to equal the expectation in the allotted time

Type
Exception
Returns:

Returns true if the page title is correct

Type
boolean

<static> waitForVisible(selector, timeout, interval, error, reverse) → {boolean}

Determines if an element is or is not visible on a page

We created this function in response to the WebdriverIO waitForVisible function fritzing out on us http://webdriver.io/api/utility/waitForVisible.html, https://github.com/emmadev/quarts/issues/250

Parameters:
Name Type Description
selector string

element to wait for
timeout int

(optional) - in ms (default: 5000)
interval int

(optional) - between condition checks (default: 250)
error string

(optional) - Error message to display
reverse boolean

(optional) - checks that element is visible if true, or not visible if false (default: true)
Source:
  • pageObjects/_base.page.js, line 219
Returns:

If true, the element is currently visible

Type
boolean
